channel.title: Beginning Front-end
channel.description:
This is my attempt at (the front-end part) of a website after looking over Bootstrap(I'm new) today. This is all I plan to get done for a little while, because my JS knowledge on a scale of 1 to 10 is a 0. And a website without functionality isn't worth building for any business, as I plan to do for volunteer work, as I am a senior in High School to add to my portfolio.
http://www.janimalhouse.comlu.com
Yes, I am using a free host and domain currently, as I plan to use until I get really motivated into doing this type of stuff. This website is not completed, just the building blocks have been set on most tabs. 3/5 I plan to learn some functionality with JS before pushing on this too hard.
All I am asking for this is a few pointers from knowledgeable members, Thanks.

item.title: Beginning Front-end
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Adobe, post:51, topic:555041”]Tried out Skeleton for about 30 minutes, other than that, this is raw. (Personal thought: ugly)
But it was a quick try with it. And all I currently know is basic html/css/js so adding grids isn’t changing too much.

Free Web Hosting

Free Web Hosting - Your Website need to be migrated

Absolutely Free Web Hosting with PHP, MySQL, cPanel and no Ads!

Still huge room for improvement but if you just view source on your homepage it looks a lot neater and tidier already. Well done for the improvement on the code organising. Now focus on your CSS positioning and look at Paletton for finding colours that properly compliment each other and fit well in a design, it does all the hard work for you. All you gotta do is pick your base colour.

Good job on the improvement so far though!

Read full topic

item.title: Beginning Front-end
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

Ecko:

You can, but that’s not Python’s philosophy. There should only be one obvious way of doing something. That is now how Ruby was designed at all. Python is definitely more in demand than Ruby (this is factual, not just an opinion). Python is easily readable, which makes having multiple Python developers working on a project is way more efficient than having multiple Ruby developers (speaking from experience).

I don’t think you know python or ruby.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Adobe Adobe
item.description:
@Adobe wrote:

Tried out Skeleton for about 30 minutes, other than that, this is raw. (Personal thought: ugly)
But it was a quick try with it. And all I currently know is basic html/css/js so adding grids isn’t changing too much.

item.title: Beginning Front-end
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

[quote=“my-swagger, post:48, topic:555041”][quote author=Ecko link=topic=673963.msg4506848#msg4506848 date=1460234811]

Just because something isn’t largely popular in other fields does not mean it can’t be efficiently used in them. You can create games with Ruby, full graphical applications.

If anything, JRuby opens the Ruby language up to an even larger amount of possibilities.

What you just said is everything Python is. Ruby tried to be Python. It was too late.
[/quote]Haha, what… Except Python looks like dongs, it’s support is dongs, and it’s packages are dongs. EVEN IF Ruby tried to be like Python, which is retarded to think so, it will far surpass Python in Ruby’s upcoming versions.

The support community for Python is vastly superior than the support for Ruby. If you ask a question on how to do something in Ruby, guess what? There’s a hundred different ways to do the same thing, which is just plain stupid. That is the opposite of why Python is and one of the reasons why Python programmers are much more in demand than for Ruby. In fact, most companies that want someone who knows Ruby is because they are working with Rails.

Not a valid argument. I could give you a hundred different approaches to a problem in python if you wanted. The same with Java. Python is not really “more” indemand then Ruby, it’s just been around longer allowing it to build a better foundation.[/quote]
You can, but that’s not Python’s philosophy. There should only be one obvious way of doing something. That is now how Ruby was designed at all. Python is definitely more in demand than Ruby (this is factual, not just an opinion). Python is easily readable, which makes having multiple Python developers working on a project is way more efficient than having multiple Ruby developers (speaking from experience).

Read full topic

item.title: Beginning Front-end
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“my-swagger, post:48, topic:555041”][quote author=Ecko link=topic=673963.msg4506848#msg4506848 date=1460234811]

Just because something isn’t largely popular in other fields does not mean it can’t be efficiently used in them. You can create games with Ruby, full graphical applications.

If anything, JRuby opens the Ruby language up to an even larger amount of possibilities.

What you just said is everything Python is. Ruby tried to be Python. It was too late.
[/quote]Haha, what… Except Python looks like dongs, it’s support is dongs, and it’s packages are dongs. EVEN IF Ruby tried to be like Python, which is retarded to think so, it will far surpass Python in Ruby’s upcoming versions.

The support community for Python is vastly superior than the support for Ruby. If you ask a question on how to do something in Ruby, guess what? There’s a hundred different ways to do the same thing, which is just plain stupid. That is the opposite of why Python is and one of the reasons why Python programmers are much more in demand than for Ruby. In fact, most companies that want someone who knows Ruby is because they are working with Rails.

Not a valid argument. I could give you a hundred different approaches to a problem in python if you wanted. The same with Java. Python is not really “more” indemand then Ruby, it’s just been around longer allowing it to build a better foundation.[/quote]Could hardly say it has a better foundation either.

Read full topic

item.title: Beginning Front-end
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

[quote=“Ecko, post:47, topic:555041”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=673963.msg4506672#msg4506672 date=1459909517]

Just because something isn’t largely popular in other fields does not mean it can’t be efficiently used in them. You can create games with Ruby, full graphical applications.

If anything, JRuby opens the Ruby language up to an even larger amount of possibilities.

What you just said is everything Python is. Ruby tried to be Python. It was too late.
[/quote]Haha, what… Except Python looks like dongs, it’s support is dongs, and it’s packages are dongs. EVEN IF Ruby tried to be like Python, which is retarded to think so, it will far surpass Python in Ruby’s upcoming versions.

The support community for Python is vastly superior than the support for Ruby. If you ask a question on how to do something in Ruby, guess what? There’s a hundred different ways to do the same thing, which is just plain stupid. That is the opposite of why Python is and one of the reasons why Python programmers are much more in demand than for Ruby. In fact, most companies that want someone who knows Ruby is because they are working with Rails.[/quote]
Not a valid argument. I could give you a hundred different approaches to a problem in python if you wanted. The same with Java. Python is not really “more” indemand then Ruby, it’s just been around longer allowing it to build a better foundation.

Read full topic

item.title: Beginning Front-end
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:45, topic:555041”][quote author=justaguy link=topic=673963.msg4506671#msg4506671 date=1459909412]

Just because something isn’t largely popular in other fields does not mean it can’t be efficiently used in them. You can create games with Ruby, full graphical applications.

If anything, JRuby opens the Ruby language up to an even larger amount of possibilities.

What you just said is everything Python is. Ruby tried to be Python. It was too late.
[/quote]Haha, what… Except Python looks like dongs, it’s support is dongs, and it’s packages are dongs. EVEN IF Ruby tried to be like Python, which is retarded to think so, it will far surpass Python in Ruby’s upcoming versions. [/quote]
The support community for Python is vastly superior than the support for Ruby. If you ask a question on how to do something in Ruby, guess what? There’s a hundred different ways to do the same thing, which is just plain stupid. That is the opposite of why Python is and one of the reasons why Python programmers are much more in demand than for Ruby. In fact, most companies that want someone who knows Ruby is because they are working with Rails.

item.title: Beginning Front-end
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:36, topic:555041”][quote author=Death Style link=topic=673963.msg4506623#msg4506623 date=1459823849]
I recommend you learn js and try node out once you feel comfortable with it

it will save you from ever having to use something gross like php or xampp
[/quote]js is gross. Use Ruby

In other words, you can use Ruby (Opal), compile to js, and just run js without having to use shitty syntax of javascript[/quote]
god bless javascript the book of genesis itself could be replaced with the 10 days it took to craft this magnificently beautiful language people that actually enjoy ruby might suffer from a severe case of stockholm syndrome and hipsteritis and any ruby/coffeescript cross-compiled to js is disgusting trash that should be burned in eternal hellfire amen

Read full topic

item.title: Beginning Front-end
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:39, topic:555041”][quote author=justaguy link=topic=673963.msg4506627#msg4506627 date=1459828054]

[quote author=Pwnd link=topic=673963.msg4506626#msg4506626 date=1459827569]

I recommend you learn js and try node out once you feel comfortable with it

it will save you from ever having to use something gross like php or xampp
[/quote]js is gross. Use Ruby

In other words, you can use Ruby (Opal), compile to js, and just run js without having to use shitty syntax of javascript

How’s it feel using a language that has no use except for Rails?

[size=6pt]tbh I know Ruby too so I know the feels[/size]
[/quote]What…[/quote]

You know it’s true… name one other thing Ruby is known for outside of Rails.

Read full topic

Asana for project management.

is not

item.title: Beginning Front-end
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Adobe:

Honestly I don’t think I could think of another question that you haven’t already answered. I’ve been practicing and will continue doing so. Your posts have been inspiring and very beneficial to myself and probably others that read them wondering the same things. Thanks, Ruby. I’ll be back with more questions as I go I’m sure, hope you stick around for those times!

Perfect, no problem at all I’m happy to help!

If you post some of your code/designs here I’ll tell you where you could improve etc too and hopefully that will pick up on any early mistakes made!

I’ve been here for many many years and I’ll be here for many more

Read full topic
